Murder In 
      The Fast Lane 
Saturday, April 28, at 10 p.m. 
      ET/PT
 
Racing legend Mickey Thompson 
      made headlines in 1960, when he set the land speed record of 406 miles per 
      hour in the salt flats of the Utah desert. 
 
In 1988, he made headlines 
      again, for how he died: Mickey and his wife Trudy were murdered 
      execution-style outside their California home.
 
There was no gun, no DNA, no 
      hard evidence at all. But there was Mickey Thompson’s sister, Collene 
      Campbell, who vowed to find justice.  
      After 20 years, has a killer finally met his 
      match?
 
Correspondent Bill 
      Lagattuta 
      reports for 48 Hours 
      Mystery, this Saturday, April 28, at 10 p.m. 
      ET/PT.
 
Click 
      here to 
      watch Bill Lagattuta's reporter's notebook.
